meta.description: A responsive, performant implementation of the 2048 game with buttery-smooth 60fps CSS animations, styled score and controls.

objectives.primary: Deliver a fully functional, responsive 2048 game that follows the classic rules and runs with smooth 60fps CSS-driven animations.
keyPrinciples: Buttery-smooth 60fps animations using CSS transforms and transitions
Responsive layout for multiple screen sizes
Clear visual hierarchy for score and controls

features.name: Game core: grid, tiles, movement and merging
requirements: Render a 4x4 grid and tile components
Implement slide mechanics so tiles move as far as possible in the chosen direction
Implement merge rules: matching tiles merge into their sum and a tile may only merge once per move
Spawn a new tile (2 or 4) after each valid move
Allow continuing play after reaching 2048
acceptanceCriteria: Tiles slide to the furthest available cell when moving
Matching tiles merge into the correct summed value and do not merge twice in the same move
A new tile appears after each valid move
Game can detect win at 2048 but allows continuing play

features.name: Input controls (keyboard and touch)
requirements: Support arrow keys for desktop keyboard input
Support swipe gestures for touch devices
Prevent inputs while animations are running to avoid conflicting moves
acceptanceCriteria: Arrow keys trigger moves reliably on desktop
Swipe gestures trigger the correct directional move on mobile
Inputs are ignored while the current move animation is in progress

features.name: Animations & performance
requirements: Use CSS transforms and transitions to animate tile movement and merges
Keep animations targeting composited properties to achieve 60fps (translate/scale/opacity only)
Ensure animations do not cause layout thrashing or forced reflows
acceptanceCriteria: Tile movement and merge animations run smoothly at 60fps on target devices
No visual stuttering or layout shifts during animations

features.name: Responsive UI & layout
requirements: Grid and controls scale appropriately across mobile, tablet, and desktop
Buttons and interactive elements remain touch-friendly at small sizes
Maintain visual clarity and spacing at different breakpoints
acceptanceCriteria: Layout adapts at common breakpoints with no overlap or clipped elements
Controls remain usable on small screens (minimum touch target size respected)
Visual design and tile sizes scale proportionally

features.name: Score display and buttons styling
requirements: Style score area and control buttons with hover and touch animations
Show current score and high score
Provide a New Game / Restart button with animated affordance
acceptanceCriteria: Score and high score are updated correctly after moves
Buttons display hover/press animations and are responsive to touch
Restart starts a fresh game and resets score

features.name: Game state, persistence and edge conditions
requirements: Detect game over when no moves remain
Optionally persist high score and current game state to local storage
Graceful handling of invalid moves (no new tile spawned)
acceptanceCriteria: Game over state is shown when no moves are possible
High score persists across page reloads if enabled
Invalid moves do not spawn a new tile and do not change score

deliverables: Playable 2048 game (HTML/CSS/JS) implementing rules listed in PROMPT.md
CSS animations achieving smooth 60fps movement and merges
Unit/integration tests for core game logic (optional but recommended)
Developer documentation (how to run, build, and test)
